thread.title: Re: Geraldo Rivera calls deportation of Guadalupe Garcia de Rayos ‘totally creepy’ and un-American
thread.title_full: Re: Geraldo Rivera calls deportation of Guadalupe Garcia de Rayos ‘totally creepy’ and un-American

author: csheel00
title: Re: Geraldo Rivera calls deportation of Guadalupe Garcia de Rayos ‘totally creepy’ and un-American
text:
Geraldo Rivera calls deportation of Guadalupe Garcia de Rayos ‘totally creepy’ and un-American Posted at 9:57 pm on February 9, 2017 by William A. 
As Twitchy reported, several were arrested overnight in Phoenix as protesters attempted to stop the deportation of Guadalupe Garcia de Rayos, a 35-year-old illegal immigrant from Mesa, Ariz. 'Now they're deporting her': Protests hit Phoenix over possible deportation of Guadalupe Garcia de Rayos https://t.co/yf6Og5qd3i 
— Twitchy Team (@TwitchyTeam) February 9, 2017 
Here is some more video from the protest, which spilled into the streets: Protestors temporarily blocking Metro Train in DT #Phoenix #GuadalupeGarcia pic.twitter.com/twyBSaTUnv 
— Gadi Schwartz (@GadiNBC) February 9, 2017 Protestors now moving onto Central Ave streets in #Phx #GuadalupeGarcia pic.twitter.com/gNAPYOI2ec 
— Gadi Schwartz (@GadiNBC) February 9, 2017 A caravan of vehicles just left #ICE in Phoenix. protestors start screaming as they drive away. officers clear the street. #GuadalupeGarcia pic.twitter.com/sSwiIowWgV 
— Gadi Schwartz (@GadiNBC) February 9, 2017 Our 11th Hour report on the deportation of #GuadalupeGarcia https://t.co/pmoiI3hXMP 
— Gadi Schwartz (@GadiNBC) February 9, 2017 The detention and deportation of Guadalupe Garcia de Rayos has sparked protests in Arizona. We learn more from @azdangonzalez #PBSNews pic.twitter.com/2RA2V6hqSs 
— PBS NewsHour (@NewsHour) February 10, 2017 Trending Troll-a-Palooza! Kellyanne Conway zings Hillary's slam on Trump after Ninth Circuit ruling 
Geraldo Rivera called the deportation “totally creepy” and un-American: Deportation of #Guadalupe after 21 yrs & 2 USA citizen children totally creepy. Who is better off to deny these kids their mom? Un-American! 
— Geraldo Rivera (@GeraldoRivera) February 9, 2017 
Congresswoman Judy Chu tweeted her support: “The only crime my mother committed was to work to give a better life for her children,” I stand w/ #GuadalupeGarcia https://t.co/dNjOYj9ZdH 
— Judy Chu (@RepJudyChu) February 9, 2017 
Congresswoman Nanette Barragan: 
— Nanette D. Barragan (@RepBarragan) February 10, 2017 
The mayor of Phoenix also issued a statement, saying that what happened was “a travesty”: Phoenix @MayorStanton statement on ICE deportation of #GuadalupeGarcia . 'What happened last night [to her] is a travesty.' #12News pic.twitter.com/hdVUFEP2qv 
— Evan Rosenfeld (@Evan_Rosenfeld) February 9, 2017 
Meanwhile, this story is not over: "What we're seeing is a mass operation where large numbers of people are being picked up."– @AngelicaCHIRLA pic.twitter.com/Nz44oUAgrt 
— Julia Wick (@sherlyholmes) February 10, 2017 #CHIRLA demonstration outside the federal jail seeking information ICE sweeps that were reported today. pic.twitter.com/5MAVYu8QaL 
— Marcus Yam (@yamphoto) February 10, 2017 I'm driving to Nogales, Mexico w/ Jacqueline & Angel, children of Guadalupe Rayos, deported this morning. They're talking to her on phone. pic.twitter.com/9f8F3sCYIF 
— Fernanda Santos (@fernandaNYT) February 10, 2017 
ICE must be aware it’s seen as the bad guy most of the time for doing its job and issued its own tweet Thursday afternoon. ICE enforces our nation’s immigration laws in a professional manner. pic.twitter.com/UlVirpQphE
